alert.note: Alert for Seminole (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 04 at 11:25PM CDT until May 05 at 1:30AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Northern Seminole County in east central Oklahoma... * Until 130 AM CDT. * At 1125 PM CDT, thunderstorms were approaching the warned area. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area over the next 2 to 3 hours. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Seminole, Cromwell and Little. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 203 and 213. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-1.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
